page.title: 01Introduction to Debenham.
page.content: The village of Debenham is in the rolling countryside of High Suffolk.It is a very fertile area with a mixture of soils,very suitable for arable farming.The land drains into the river Deben which flows eastward to the sea north of Felixstowe.The area was once heavily forested but has now lost all its woodland,apart from one small plantation. Debenham was chosen as a Heritage Village by the English Tourist Board in 1975.The seven antique shops indicate its importance as a tourist centre.The village has achieved a harmonious blend of old and new.It has many old buildings-part of St.Mary's Church is Saxon-and several new housing estates.With a population approaching 2000,it is an active, growing village,attracting commuters to Stowmarket,Ipswich and even London.
